description: Showing client errors but using JOIN which might be 'query' intensive.

panels.description: Number of request group by HTTP Status Code

targets.rawSql:
SELECT toString(statusCode) as HTTP_Status_Code, $__timeInterval(reqTimeSec) as time, count(*) as http
FROM ${table}
WHERE $__timeFilter(reqTimeSec)
AND $__conditionalAll( statusCode IN (${errorCode:sqlstring}), $statusCode)
AND $__conditionalAll( reqHost IN (${reqHost:sqlstring}), $reqHost)
AND $__conditionalAll(cliIP ${AND_cliIP} (${clientIP:sqlstring}), $clientIP)
GROUP BY HTTP_Status_Code, time ORDER BY time
SETTINGS hdx_query_max_execution_time=60, hdx_query_admin_comment='akamai - 4xxresp - ${__user.login}'

panels.title: 4xx resp. over time per $__interval

panels.description: 403's per attack group over time. As an INNER JOIN is taking too long, we're now combining two queries into one dashboard. So lookup the 403's in the DS data and combine that with 'deny' actions from the SIEM logs.

targets.rawSql:
/*
 If the errorCode is not ERR_ACCESS_DENIED then only use the 'main' part before the |
 We're ignoring the ERR_ACCESS_DENIED|waf but want to know some details when delivery part is blocking the request.
 So this query will only give the requests that are blocked by the CDN for whatever reason.
 If there is no errorCode but a 403 it's blocked by the WAF.
 */
SELECT $__timeInterval(reqTimeSec) AS time,
IF (isNull(errorCode), 'ERR_ACCESS_DENIED_BY_ORIGIN', splitByChar('|', assumeNotNull(errorCode))[1]) AS tag, count(*) as total
FROM ${database}.logs
WHERE $__timeFilter(reqTimeSec)
AND $__conditionalAll( reqHost IN (${reqHost:sqlstring}), $reqHost)
AND $__conditionalAll(cliIP ${AND_cliIP} (${clientIP:sqlstring}), $clientIP)
AND statusCode = 403
--AND isNotNull(errorCode)
AND (errorCode != 'ERR_ACCESS_DENIED|waf' OR isNull(errorCode))
GROUP BY tag, time
ORDER BY time
SETTINGS hdx_query_max_execution_time=60, hdx_query_admin_comment='akamai - 403s_logs - ${__user.login}'

/*
This query will lookup all the deny events in the SIEM logs and will group based on the attack type, like SQLi for example
*/
SELECT $__timeInterval(timestamp) AS time, ruleTags[indexOf(ruleActions, 'deny')] AS tag, count(*) as total
FROM ${database}.siem
WHERE $__timeFilter(timestamp)
AND hasAny(ruleActions,['deny'])
AND $__conditionalAll( host IN (${reqHost:sqlstring}), $host)
AND $__conditionalAll(clientIP ${AND_cliIP} (${clientIP:sqlstring}), $clientIP)
GROUP BY tag, time
ORDER BY time
SETTINGS hdx_query_max_execution_time=60, hdx_query_admin_comment='akamai - 403s_siem - ${__user.login}'

panels.title: 403's resp. per group CDN/WAF

panels.description:
Show the 403's generated by either the CDN configuration or security layer. This doesn't include and "bot" related mitigations like tarpit, slow etc. 

This will work fine for a small number of records but will timeout if there are too many records as using an INNER JOIN is a very bad idea: https://hydrolix.io/blog/handling-multiple-groupings-in-a-single-pass/

But leaving this one here for now as I'm still impressed by the SQL. ðŸ˜‰

targets.rawSql:
/*
Not every 403 is generated by the WAF, can be generated by the delivery config or origin which don't trigger a SIEM event.
So using LEFT JOIN to also get 403's without a SIEM entry but we need to create some 'dummy' CDN/Origin warnings.
But if blocked by the origin there is no errorCode.
*/
SELECT ID as requestId, time, cliIP as Client, replaceRegexpOne(lcase(reqHost), ':\d*$', '') as reqHost, reqPath,
if(isNull(errorCode), 'Origin', splitByChar('|', assumeNotNull(errorCode))[2]) as denied_by,
/*
If there is no SIEM entry, tag and message will be null. If there is no SIEM entry it's created by the delivery config.
But SIEM integration might not be available yet, so creating some special if statements to check that.
Format of if: if(cond, then, else)
*/
if(denied_by = 'Origin', 'ORIGIN', if(isNull(tag), if(denied_by!='waf', 'CDN','no SIEM entry available'), tag)) AS rules,
if(denied_by = 'Origin', 'Blocked by Origin', if(isNull(message),if(denied_by!='waf', 'Blocked by delivery configuration','no SIEM entry available'), message)) AS messages
FROM (
	SELECT reqId as ID, errorCode, cliIP, replaceRegexpOne(lcase(reqHost), ':\d*$', '') as reqHost, reqPath, reqTimeSec as time
	FROM ${database}.logs
	WHERE $__timeFilter(reqTimeSec)
	AND statusCode = 403
	AND $__conditionalAll(reqHost IN (${reqHost:sqlstring}), $reqHost)
	AND $__conditionalAll(cliIP ${AND_cliIP} (${clientIP:sqlstring}), $clientIP)
	/*
	if you're not interested in origin genereted 403's uncomment the isNotNull.
	--AND isNotNull(errorCode) 
	*/
	--LIMIT 500
) l LEFT JOIN (
	/* 
	We're only interested in the deny messages, no need to show any "monitoring/alert" events.
	Let's get the index of the first deny action and corresponding ruleMessage and ruleTag using the same index.
	Make sure to use the __timefilter otherwise you will see timeouts!
	*/
	SELECT requestId AS ID, indexOf(ruleActions, 'deny') AS index, ruleMessages[index] AS message, ruleTags[index] AS tag
	FROM ${database}.siem
	WHERE $__timeFilter(timestamp)
	AND $__conditionalAll( host IN (${reqHost:sqlstring}), $host)
	AND $__conditionalAll(clientIP ${AND_cliIP} (${clientIP:sqlstring}), $clientIP)
	-- For now only filtering on deny, this might be extended with some specific bot rules later.
	AND hasAny(ruleActions,['deny'])
	--LIMIT 500
) r USING (ID)
ORDER BY time DESC
LIMIT 500
SETTINGS hdx_query_max_execution_time=120, hdx_query_admin_comment='akamai - error - ${__user.login}'

panels.title: 403's per rule over time using SQL  INNER JOIN. ðŸ¤ž

panels.description: 403's per attack group over time. As an INNER JOIN is taking too long, we're now combining two queries into one dashboard. So lookup the 403's in the DS data and combine that with 'deny' actions from the SIEM logs OUTER JOINed by the reqId using a Grafana transformer. Also using a LIMIT to restrict the number of records returned.

targets.rawSql:
/*
 If the errorCode is not ERR_ACCESS_DENIED then only use the 'main' part before the |
 We're ignoring the ERR_ACCESS_DENIED|waf but want to know some details when delivery part is blocking the request.
 So this query will only give the requests that are blocked by the CDN for whatever reason.
 If there is no errorCode but a 403 it's blocked by the WAF.
 */
SELECT reqTimeSec AS time, reqId, cliIP, reqHost, reqPath,
IF (isNull(errorCode), 'Origin', splitByChar('|', assumeNotNull(errorCode))[2]) AS tag
FROM ${database}.logs
WHERE $__timeFilter(reqTimeSec)
AND $__conditionalAll( reqHost IN (${reqHost:sqlstring}), $reqHost)
AND $__conditionalAll(cliIP ${AND_cliIP} (${clientIP:sqlstring}), $clientIP)
AND statusCode = 403
--AND isNotNull(errorCode)
--AND (errorCode != 'ERR_ACCESS_DENIED|waf' OR isNull(errorCode))
ORDER BY time DESC
LIMIT 500
SETTINGS hdx_query_max_execution_time=60, hdx_query_admin_comment='akamai - 403s_logs - ${__user.login}'

/*
This query will lookup all the deny events in the SIEM logs and will group based on the attack type, like SQLi for example
*/
SELECT indexOf(ruleActions, 'deny') AS index, ruleTags[index] AS tag, requestId AS reqId, ruleMessages[index] AS message
FROM ${database}.siem
WHERE $__timeFilter(timestamp)
AND hasAny(ruleActions,['deny'])
AND $__conditionalAll( host IN (${reqHost:sqlstring}), $host)
AND $__conditionalAll(clientIP ${AND_cliIP} (${clientIP:sqlstring}), $clientIP)
ORDER BY timestamp DESC
LIMIT 500
SETTINGS hdx_query_max_execution_time=60, hdx_query_admin_comment='akamai - 403s_siem - ${__user.login}'

panels.title: 403's resp. per group CDN/WAF using a Grafana OUTER JOIN transformer on reqid.

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
    count(), replaceRegexpOne(lcase(reqHost), ':\d*$', '') as reqHost
FROM ${table}
WHERE $__timeFilter(reqTimeSec)
AND $__conditionalAll( statusCode IN (${errorCode:sqlstring}), $statusCode)
AND $__conditionalAll(cliIP ${AND_cliIP} (${clientIP:sqlstring}), $clientIP)
AND $__conditionalAll(reqHost IN (${reqHost:sqlstring}), $reqHost)
GROUP BY reqHost
ORDER BY count() DESC
SETTINGS hdx_query_max_execution_time=120, hdx_query_admin_comment='akamai - topPath - ${__user.login}'

SELECT
    count(),
    cliIP
FROM ${table}
WHERE $__timeFilter(reqTimeSec)
AND $__conditionalAll( statusCode IN (${errorCode:sqlstring}), $statusCode)
AND $__conditionalAll( reqHost IN (${reqHost:sqlstring}), $reqHost)
GROUP BY cliIP
ORDER BY count() DESC
LIMIT 10
SETTINGS hdx_query_max_execution_time=120, hdx_query_admin_comment='akamai - error_per_client - ${__user.login}'

SELECT
    count(),
    country
FROM ${table}
WHERE $__timeFilter(reqTimeSec)
AND $__conditionalAll( statusCode IN (${errorCode:sqlstring}), $statusCode)
AND $__conditionalAll( reqHost IN (${reqHost:sqlstring}), $reqHost)
GROUP BY country
ORDER BY count() DESC
LIMIT 10
SETTINGS hdx_query_max_execution_time=120, hdx_query_admin_comment='akamai - error_per_client - ${__user.login}'

panels.description:
Cache Hit Ratio :
sum of all request with cacheStatus: 1 / divided by total count of request

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
        time, cache_hit 
    FROM
        ( SELECT
            $__timeInterval(reqTimeSec) as time,
            sumIf(cacheStatus, 1) as "cached",
            cached/count() * 100 as "cache_hit" 
        FROM
            ${table} 
        WHERE
            $__timeFilter(reqTimeSec) 
            AND $__conditionalAll( statusCode IN (${errorCode:sqlstring}), $statusCode)
            AND $__conditionalAll( reqHost IN (${reqHost:sqlstring}), $reqHost)
            AND $__conditionalAll(cliIP ${AND_cliIP} (${clientIP:sqlstring}), $clientIP)
        GROUP BY time 
        ORDER BY time) 
        SETTINGS hdx_query_max_execution_time=60, hdx_query_admin_comment='akamai - cachehit - ${__user.login}'

panels.title: Cache Hit Ratio

targets.rawSql:
SELECT $__timeInterval(reqTimeSec) as time,
sum(totalBytes) as Bytes_Delivered
FROM ${table}
WHERE $__timeFilter(reqTimeSec)
AND $__conditionalAll( statusCode IN (${errorCode:sqlstring}), $statusCode)
AND $__conditionalAll( reqHost IN (${reqHost:sqlstring}), $reqHost)
AND $__conditionalAll(cliIP ${AND_cliIP} (${clientIP:sqlstring}), $clientIP)
GROUP BY time ORDER BY time
SETTINGS hdx_query_max_execution_time=60, hdx_query_admin_comment='akamai - bytes - ${__user.login}'

panels.description: Check the objects that are still being requested but don't exist anymore. Maybe inform the backend team to do some cleanup. ;-)

targets.rawSql:
WITH (
        SELECT topK(50)(reqPath)
        FROM ${table}
        WHERE $__timeFilter(reqTimeSec)
        AND statusCode = '404'
        AND $__conditionalAll( replaceRegexpOne(lcase(reqHost), ':\d*$', '') as reqHost IN (${reqHost:sqlstring}), $reqHost)
        AND $__conditionalAll(cliIP ${AND_cliIP} (${clientIP:sqlstring}), $clientIP)
    ) AS top_50_reqPath
SELECT
    count(),
    reqPath,
    replaceRegexpOne(lcase(reqHost), ':\d*$', '') as reqHost,
    sum(bytes) as total_bytes,
    round(avg(bytes)) as avg_bytes
FROM ${table}
WHERE $__timeFilter(reqTimeSec) AND has(top_50_reqPath, reqPath)
GROUP BY reqPath, reqHost
ORDER BY count() DESC
SETTINGS hdx_query_max_execution_time=120, hdx_query_admin_comment='akamai - topPath - ${__user.login}'

panels.title: Top 50 404's per reqpath

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
    count(),
    cliIP
FROM ${table}
WHERE $__timeFilter(reqTimeSec)
AND statusCode = '404'
AND $__conditionalAll( reqHost IN (${reqHost:sqlstring}), $reqHost)
GROUP BY cliIP
ORDER BY count() DESC
LIMIT 10
SETTINGS hdx_query_max_execution_time=120, hdx_query_admin_comment='akamai - error_per_client - ${__user.login}'

/*
some issues with OSS version of grafana so converting Map(String, Nullable(String)) to strings
*/
SELECT reqId::String,
    toString(unknown) as unknown, 
		*
		EXCEPT unknown
FROM ${database}.logs
WHERE $__timeFilter(reqTimeSec)
--AND requestId = '67d24c3e'
AND $__conditionalAll(reqId IN (${requestId:sqlstring}), $requestId)
LIMIT 100

panels.description: Raw data for the different SIEM entries

targets.rawSql:
/*
some issues with OSS version of grafana so converting Map(String, Nullable(String)) to strings
*/
SELECT requestId::String,
    toString(botData) as botData,
		toString(clientData) as clientData,
		toString(requestHeaders) as requestHeaders,
		toString(responseHeaders) as responseHeaders,
		toString(userRiskData) as userRiskData, 
		*
		EXCEPT (botData, clientData, requestHeaders, responseHeaders, userRiskData)
FROM ${database}.siem
WHERE $__timeFilter(timestamp)
--AND requestId = '67d24c3e'
AND $__conditionalAll(requestId IN (${requestId:sqlstring}), $requestId)
LIMIT 100

panels.title: SIEM entries

list.definition:
SELECT
    replaceRegexpOne(lcase(reqHost), ':\d*$', '')
FROM ${table}
WHERE $__timeFilter(reqTimeSec)
AND $__conditionalAll( statusCode IN (${errorCode:sqlstring}), $statusCode)
GROUP BY reqHost
ORDER BY reqHost
SETTINGS hdx_query_max_execution_time=120, hdx_query_admin_comment='akamai - 403hosts - ${__user.login}'

    replaceRegexpOne(lcase(reqHost), ':\d*$', '')
FROM ${table}
WHERE $__timeFilter(reqTimeSec)
AND $__conditionalAll( statusCode IN (${errorCode:sqlstring}), $statusCode)
GROUP BY reqHost
ORDER BY reqHost
SETTINGS hdx_query_max_execution_time=120, hdx_query_admin_comment='akamai - 403hosts - ${__user.login}'
